page.title: 05PUBLIC TRANSPORT IN WHALTON
page.content: Compared with many rural communities Whalton is lucky in that it has a regular,if infrequent, bus service. There are three services which run during the week but none on Sunday. From Whalton it is possible to get to Newcastle (3 buses a day), Ponteland (6 buses a day), Morpeth (5 buses a day) and Hexham (8 buses a week). The last bus comes through the village at 6.30pm so that people without cars cannot visit say the cinema in Morpeth unless they are fit enough to walk or rich enough to hire a taxi. Parents of teenagers too young to drive find themselves running a taxi service to and from the local towns so that their children can participate in activities such as Girl Guides, Young Farmers etc.
